runs.login_message: Please sign in below using the credentials supplied to you

[CUSTOM_URL]

- Online surveys Team
runs.notification_invite_subject: You have been sent a survey to complete
runs.notification_reminder_body:
Dear [EMAIL]
We have not yet detected your response to our survey.

[CUSTOM_URL]

- Online surveys Team

children.label: b65364608
children.text:
Thank you for your participation in the ENLIGHT consensus exercise. We are very enthusiastic about this project and look forward to working with you.

Please read the information and questions in this survey carefully.

 

About this survey

We are interested in defining best practices for documenting and reporting light interventions in laboratory-based research conducted in human participants, with a specific focus on research on the effects of ocular light exposure on non-visual physiology.

This survey should take no more than 30 minutes to complete. You can follow your progress in the top right corner.

After asking a series of demographic questions, you will be asked to make ratings on the importance of various reporting items related to light interventions. Please make every rating independently.

In this round, we are asking for your judgment on the importance. In the next round(s), we will specifically focus on how (i.e. the format) that specific things should be reported in. Please keep this in mind as you are answering the questions.

 

Questions and comments?

If you have any questions throughout the survey, please feel free to reach out to any member of the ENLIGHT team, or our general email adderss at enlight@lightcat.group.

If you find that some ratings are difficult to do, please include this in the comments box for each section.

children.label: b60659831
children.text: Please enter your unique 5-character survey code. This code was sent to you in the email with the survey link. The form of the code is Nxxxx, where xxxx are four numbers (e.g. N3039).

children.label: b65364487
children.text: First, we would like to learn a little bit more about you. This helps us monitor the diversity of our responders. Please answer the following demographic questions truthfully.

children.label: b60659767
children.text: What is your sex?

children.label: b65363513
children.text: Is the gender you identify with the same as your sex registered at birth?

children.label: b65363583
children.text: If "No", please write in your gender identity.

children.label: b60659828
children.text: Do you have a PhD or another research-based doctoral degree?

children.label: b60659829
children.text: What year did you receive your (first) PhD or other research-based doctoral degree?

children.label: b60659847
children.text: What is your main role?

children.label: b60659848
children.text: If you selected Other, please specify:

children.label: b60659850
children.text: What model organism are you working with? If you're work does not involve working with subjects, please don't select any answer and/or include it in the "Other" category.

children.label: b60659851
children.text: If you selected Other, please specify:

children.label: b65364261
children.text:
In which country/countries do you currently live and work? We ask this to understand the diversity of the responders.

If you identify to work in multiple countries, please separate them by a semicolon.

children.label: b65364778
children.text: Which discipline(s) do you identify to work in? (E.g. neuroscience, lighting science, ...). If you identify to work in multiple disciplines, please separate them by a semicolon.

children.label: b62236340
children.text: How would you rate your knowledge of measuring light interventions?

children.label: b65364284
children.text: How would you rate your knowledge of documenting light interventions?

children.label: b60759630
children.text: What is the importance of the following protocol-level aspects of light interventions?

children.label: b60759631
children.text: Timeline of laboratory experiment

options.text: X – Don't know or recognise this quantity/item and cannot evaluate

children.label: b60759633
children.text: Overall duration of the laboratory experiment

options.text: X – Don't know or recognise this quantity/item and cannot evaluate

children.label: b65364971
children.text: Timing of light intervention (in clock time)

options.text: X – Don't know or recognise this quantity/item and cannot evaluate

children.label: b65364973
children.text: Duration of the light intervention (in min or h)

options.text: X – Don't know or recognise this quantity/item and cannot evaluate

children.label: b65364975
children.text: Inclusion of dim light exposure prior to intervention

options.text: X – Don't know or recognise this quantity/item and cannot evaluate

children.label: b65364977
children.text: Control of prior (before entering the laboratory) light exposure

options.text: X – Don't know or recognise this quantity/item and cannot evaluate

children.label: b60759639
children.text: Are there any other protocol-level characteristics that should be reported?

children.label: b65365785
children.text: Please add any further comments on this section.

children.label: b60758858
children.text: What is the importance of the following spectral characteristics for characterising light interventions?

children.label: b60758859
children.text: Spectral radiance distribution (in W/sr/m2/nm)

options.text: X – Don't know or recognise this quantity/item and cannot evaluate

children.label: b60758861

options.text: X – Don't know or recognise this quantity/item and cannot evaluate

children.label: b60758863
children.text: Spectral power distribution (normalised)

options.text: X – Don't know or recognise this quantity/item and cannot evaluate

children.label: b60758865
children.text: Spectral power distribution (arbitrary units)

options.text: X – Don't know or recognise this quantity/item and cannot evaluate

children.label: b65364997
children.text: Peak wavelength (in nm)

options.text: X – Don't know or recognise this quantity/item and cannot evaluate

children.label: b60758869
children.text: Are there any other spectral characteristics that should be reported?

children.label: b65365774
children.text: Please add any further comments on this section.

children.text: What is the importance of the following photometric quantities for characterising light interventions?

children.text: Illuminance (in lux)

options.text: X – Don't know or recognise this quantity/item and cannot evaluate

options.text: X – Don't know or recognise this quantity/item and cannot evaluate

children.label: b65365766
children.text: Please add any further comments on this section.

children.label: b60758931
children.text: What is the importance of the following CIE S026 quantities for characterising light interventions? Note: α-opic refers to all photoreceptors in the human retina (LMS cones, rods, ipRGCs).

options.text: X – Don't know or recognise this quantity/item and cannot evaluate

children.label: b65365762
children.text: Please add any further comments on this section.

children.label: b60759803
children.text: Do you have any general comments?

children.label: b54442568
children.text:
Many thanks for participating in this survey. We appreciate your time and effort.

We will be in touch soon with the next steps.

Have a nice day!
